dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2024, the Ministry of Healthcare in Kazakhstan just announced a really concerning measles and whooping cough situation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty twenty four, the Ministry of Healthcare in Kazakhstan just announced a really concerning measles and whooping cough situation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Ministry of Healthcare announced that Kazakhstan is currently experiencing an unfavorable epidemiological situation regarding measles and whooping cough.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they said that seventy-five percent of measles cases are in unvaccinated kids, which is, uh, a huge majority.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they said that seventy-five percent of measles cases are in unvaccinated kids, which is, uh, a huge majority.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Ministry's press service, 75 percent of measles cases and 87 percent of whooping cough cases involve children who have not received scheduled vaccinations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And it's even higher for whooping cough—eighty-seven percent. But they didn't give exact numbers of how many children are infected.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's even higher for whooping cough-eighty-seven percent. But they didn't give exact numbers of how many children are infected.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Ministry's press service, 75 percent of measles cases and 87 percent of whooping cough cases involve children who have not received scheduled vaccinations. The Ministry did not specify exactly how many children have been infected with measles and whooping cough.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but they're really urging parents to get those scheduled vaccinations done on time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but they're really urging parents to get those scheduled vaccinations done on time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Officials urged parents to ensure children are vaccinated on time.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: They also mentioned that this week is actually European Immunization Week in Kazakhstan, running from April twenty-seventh to May third.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They also mentioned that this week is actually European Immunization Week in Kazakhstan, running from April twenty-seventh to May third.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On April 27, Kazakhstan launched European Immunization Week, which will run until May 3.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is pretty timely, given the outbreaks. And they highlighted some real successes too—like, no polio since 1996.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is pretty timely, given the outbreaks. And they highlighted some real successes too-like, no polio since nineteen ninety six.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "Thanks to vaccinations, Kazakhstan has not recorded any cases of poliomyelitis since 1996 and diphtheria since 2009.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and diphtheria-free since 2009. The numbers they shared are impressive—mumps down over a hundred times, hepatitis A by thirty-two times…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and diphtheria-free since two thousand nine. The numbers they shared are impressive-mumps down over a hundred times, hepatitis A by thirty-two times...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "Thanks to vaccinations, Kazakhstan has not recorded any cases of poliomyelitis since 1996 and diphtheria since 2009. The incidence of mumps has decreased more than 100 times, hepatitis A by 32 times, hepatitis B by 92 times, and rubella by more than 2,000 times," the statement said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And rubella by more than two thousand times. It's shows how effective vaccination can be when coverage is high.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And rubella by more than two thousand times. It's shows how effective vaccination can be when coverage is high.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The incidence of mumps has decreased more than 100 times, hepatitis A by 32 times, hepatitis B by 92 times, and rubella by more than 2,000 times," the statement said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But clearly there's a gap now. They noted that measles outbreaks have been happening over the past two years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But clearly there's a gap now. They noted that measles outbreaks have been happening over the past two years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It should be noted that measles outbreaks were recorded in Kazakhstan over the past two years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And epidemiologists pointed directly to missed vaccinations as the reason—kids who skipped shots are the most affected.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And epidemiologists pointed directly to missed vaccinations as the reason-kids who skipped shots are the most affected.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Epidemiologists stated that the reason for the rise in cases was the significant number of children who missed scheduled vaccinations " and they were the most affected group.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Whooping cough is also on the rise for the same reason, low vaccination coverage.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whooping cough is also on the rise for the same reason, low vaccination coverage.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Doctors have also reported an increase in whooping cough cases due to low vaccination coverage.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Both diseases are so contagious—measles spreads through breathing or coughing, and whooping cough through airborne droplets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Both diseases are so contagious-measles spreads through breathing or coughing, and whooping cough through airborne droplets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The measles virus spreads easily through breathing, coughing, or sneezing by an infected person. The bacteria are transmitted via airborne droplets during coughing, sneezing, or talking.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the symptoms sound brutal, especially that "whoop" sound and vomiting with pertussis.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the symptoms sound brutal, especially that whoop sound and vomiting with pertussis.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Whooping cough (pertussis) is an acute bacterial respiratory infection caused by the bacterium Bordetella pertussis, characterized by severe bouts of spasmodic coughing followed by a "whoop" sound and vomiting, often ending with the production of thick, sticky mucus.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's a strong reminder that vaccines aren't just about individual protection—they protect the whole community.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a strong reminder that vaccines aren't just about individual protection-they protect the whole community.
